Authentication¶

This app is in charge of interfacing with plaid/the user’s bank, as well as user authentication via google

Apps¶

This app handles user authentication and signup

class authentication.apps.AuthenticationConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]¶

Standard Config

GraphQL¶

GraphQL definitions for the Authentication App

class authentication.graphql.AddTradingAccount(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

AddTradingAccount creates a new TradingAccount for the user

static mutate(_self, args, context, _info)[source]¶

Creates a TradingAccount and saves it to the DB

class authentication.graphql.DataPoint(date, value)[source]¶

Dummy class to represent a date / value DataPoint

class authentication.graphql.GDataPoint(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

GraphQL definition of the DataPoint above

class authentication.graphql.Query[source]¶

Query represents the entry method for a GraphQL request

static resolve_viewer(_self, _args, context, _info)[source]¶

The viewer represents the current logged in user

Models¶

Models keeps track of all the persistent data around the user profile

class authentication.models.Profile(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Profile represents additional values for a user account

class authentication.models.UserBank(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Contains all the user’s bank access data (via plaid)

Returns the account name

Returns the current balance

expenditure(days=30, update=False)[source]¶

Returns the expenditures in the given timespan

historical_data(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns the historical data

income(days=30, update=False)[source]¶

Returns the income in the given timespan

plaid()[source]¶

Returns a new Plaid client

authentication.models.create_user_profile(instance, created, **_)[source]¶

Creates a linked profile when a user account is created

authentication.models.save_user_profile(instance, **_)[source]¶

To be safe, whenever the user profile is saved, we also save the profile

Plaid Wrapper¶

Plaid API wrapper to provide convenience methods

class authentication.plaid_wrapper.PlaidAPI(access_token, client=None)[source]¶

Wrapper around the plaid API to establish convenience methods

account_name()[source]¶

The name of the account that the user hass

static client()[source]¶

Creates a new plaid client

current_balance()[source]¶

Returns the current numerical balance of the user

expenditure(days=30)[source]¶

Calculates the expenses a user has in a given timespan

historical_data(start)[source]¶

Returns a list of tuples that show the balance a user had at the given point in time

income(days=30)[source]¶

Calculates the income a user has per month

Views¶

Views for authentication. Basically supports login/logout.
